page.title: 04Main features-N.W.Edinburgh
page.content: The area extends from the coastline in the{north}to residential and wooded higher ground in the{south,}from council houses (some high flats) in the{east}to private houses (some detached) in the{west.}Land use varies considerably. Much is devoted to {recreation;}golf, football, camp site, and public parks. To cater for the large population there are many primary{schools}and they feed their local secondary and some private schools also. A few{large houses remain as a reminder of last century, before the city expanded; Cammo, Drylaw and Granton. Lauriston Castle and farm are visited by tourists from abroad. There is some{industry}and a number of service industries have developed to cater for a fairly large residential population.{Churches}of different types are found in the area.
